intro: Seseli carvifolia, commonly known as caraway-leaved seseli, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs such as parsley and dill. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in umbels. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. Seseli carvifolia is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it contributes to the biodiversity of these specialized ecosystems.
